fields.summary: Lock the location of the upper banner when scrolling
Order of items set in the screen configuration is not in the same order on main screen
An attachment with an issue key in its file name cannot be rendered as an inline image in an issue
Automatically switch Focus to Issue view in Detail View of JIRA Issue Navigator
Sort by Status in Issue Navigator should sort by name and not by status id
Allow additional spaces in between and after the end of text
Show class packaging information on stacktrace information in the logs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32679].
  {panel}

We've made a release for Salesforce Connector Plugin and it has been tested to work with OnDemand JIRA v6.0-SNAPSHOT#6084. 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/Core+Connector+for+JIRA+1.4.0+for+JIRA+6.0+OD11
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/JIRA+Connector+1.4.0+for+JIRA+6.0+OD11
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/~rkrishna/Connector+for+Salesforce+and+JIRA+Version%3A+5.3.0+for+JIRA+6.0+OD11

Thanks,
Abi and the team
fields.summary: Bundle the update of Salesforce Connector For JIRA to OnDemand version 6.0 - OD11
Image Attachments Break Layout in JIRA OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32677].
  {panel}

As of now, it's only possible to go from JIRA Project and its related Confluence Space from the _Project Summary_, whereas in every Confluence Page  the Space logo is active and will display relevant application links:
!conf_logo.png|thumbnail!

The Jira Project logo should be active in a similar way, so that in every screen in Jira that's related to a Project, users can display the Project links:
!jira_logo.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to switch between JIRA and Confluence within the Project context

This appears to be caused when rendering the soy template for a report that contains a large number of results. We need to look at limiting the size of the report or, if we can detect it is too large to possibly render, rejecting the request.
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryError when building time tracking report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32675].
  {panel}

Issues can only be part of one project. New Feature Request to allow an issue to appear in more than one project.

Because an issue in my industry (semiconductor manufacturing) involves several different disciplines, a single issue during its life cycle may involve several projects, and there is no clear single project where the issue belongs.

We only have the choice of moving an issue from one project to another, or cloning the issue from one project to another.

Moving is of some use since the issue numbering is permanent: if FOO-1 is moved to BAR-9, then subsequent access to FOO-1 will be forwarded to the issue BAR-9. But the FOO-1 issue no longer appears when browsing or searching the FOO project.

The other alternative is cloning; this has been very problematic for us since they are independent copies in multiple projects, and when we update an issue and add comments/attachments, they don't appear in the copy.

In addition to moving and cloning, it would be helpful to have an option to "shadow" an issue into multiple projects, so the issue has an issue number in all projects, and can be browsed/searched in all projects, but adding/modifying the issue in any of those projects will be seen in any other project. (I guess kind of like a hard link in an OS.)
fields.summary: allow an issue to be shadowed in more than one project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32658].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate*

# Create a test project
# Create version ('v1.0' for example)
# Create an issue in your test project and enter 'v1.0' in the fixversion field. Don't select the autocomplete option, just click anywhere else on the screen
# Hit Create Issue

*Result:*

Error is thrown with message 

{quote}
'Version with id 'v1.0' does not exist. 
{quote}

This happens despite the content being highlighted as if it completed successfully.

*Expected Result*

Issue is created successfully

Issue is not browser specific, happens in current versions of Firefox, Chrome and Safari

During import, I got this message: "Error importing data: com.atlassian.dbexporter.ImportExportException: java.sql.SQLException: Table 'AO_60DB71_RANK_ISSUE_LINK' does not have the identity property. Cannot perform SET operation."

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32637].
  {panel}

We've had a couple of users set up subscriptions for certain filters that would be returning less than 100 issues.
The subscription was for all logged-in users, and the filter did use the currentUser() function to generate user specific filter results.
The subscription runs once a week, and when it does, it can cause mail backups for over 2 hours.

So it would be great if one of two things were improved to help us with this:
# Have an automatic equivalent to the "Bypass currently sending mail" if any mail is taking more than a user defined period of time to send, say 5 minutes (or possibly just use the users existing mail queue flush period)
# Move the mail queue to be a non-blocking model, where one stuck mail doesn't prevent the mail behind it from being sent.
fields.summary: Automatically trigger mail bypass if a mail is "Sending" for more than x minutes or make mail queue non-blocking

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32636].
  {panel}

Many times in the comments of a JIRA issue I have to make a reference to the commit that was causing the bug, for reference.
I use GIT, so I locate the commit using git command line and get a SHA1. Adding the SHA1 to the comment is not very helpful. Others will need to copy the text and then go to git to locate the commit.
Copying the entire commit log with source code and pasting it to the comment is helpful for readers but makes the comment very large and does not help when investigating previous/following commits. 

I would like to be able to easily embed a commit into a JIRA comment, using a wiki markup like FISHEYE:12ca45f, so that the commit can be read entirely in the JIRA issue comment and that links to the commit in Fisheye, like in this screenshot
!jiracom.png!
fields.summary: Ability to embed FishEye commits to JIRA comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32623].
  {panel}

We would like a custom field that lets you insert a list (as the options for the custom field, like a select list), that has the autocomplete renderer of the User Picker and also have the ability to import, from a csv, the items on the "Edit Options" screen. It would work like a list that has a number of items. If I could 'import' that list, that would be awesome!

- additional concepts to consider:
-- using the import for a field that already has items in the list;
--# need options for "Replace All", "Replace Duplicates", "Skip Duplicates", "Append All", etc...
--# or just make the import avail on the initial creation of the field...

*Benefits/Priority*

Part 1 is truly the most important, since that is the part that makes the U/I more user friendly in dealing with such a huge list.

Part 2 obviously is a back-end/sysadmin benefit in managing the list.
fields.summary: New field type request (list with autocomplete renderer)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32617].
  {panel}

Sometimes when the JIRA server restarts automatically, JIRA fails to restart automatically (running via service).

This can leave the application down for some time until an admin is notified or notices the problem.

It would be great if JIRA could send an e-mail to the admins when it fails to start.

Since the start failure can happen before JIRA connects to the database itself, the mail server and contact information will not be available, so maybe some "emergency information" like that could be copied to a separate file which JIRA could access even without database connection.
fields.summary: JIRA to send a mail when it fails to start
Provide ability to style issue collectors

Hi,

I'm using JIRA 5.1.6 + GH 6.1.6. In the upper right I have the "take me back to the old navigator" link though clicking on it I'm taken to the normal issue navigator (but again no sign of the issues I'm interested in).

This for sure seems like a bug or a half-baked feature so could you please have a look at this?

Thanks,
Petru

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32587].
  {panel}

Also affects the notification helper plugin.

Urls are locale-indepedent resources and *should not* be i18n resources. 

This creates confusion for translators and allows the possibility of completely breaking JIRA by just using a language pack which has a bad url.

This has happened in the past where the application links project had this same type of bug and translators at translations.atlassian.com _translated_ the url into something that resembled their language.
fields.summary: Jira Administration Helper Plugin uses i18n resources to store URLs

fields.description:
Environment -
Browser: Firefox 20.0
Operating system: Mac OS
URL: https://open.jira.com/secure/VersionBoard.jspa

Steps to reproduce -
1. Opened https://open.jira.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa URL
2. Click on 'projects' and then click on 'Pebble' project
3. Click on Agile -> Classic
4. From the list of the tickets, click on '1 subs' link on any particular ticket, for example - PEBBLE-18
5. When 'sub tasks' pop up opens, look for a close button or a way to close it

Actual Result:
There is no close link or close button to close the pop up, there is no workaround to it, so user has to go to the dashboard by changing the url

Expected Result:
There should be a close button on top right corner of the pop up
fields.summary: popup of sub-tasks on classic taskboard (in not logged in state) do not have any option to close

fields.summary: problem with get approval  button in Tempo
Allow customers to upload an image file when creating custom priorities and issue types.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32572].
  {panel}

When you try to send a notification to a user that does not have permission to actually see the issue, JIRA sends the mail to the mail queue but does not actually send the email (as expected).

The problem is that there's no indication why the email is not sent to the user.

There's absolutely nothing logged in the JIRA logs and the notification helper doesn't verify that ([JRA-30447|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-30447]).

It would be great if the mail did not get sent to the mail queue in the first place, since it won't be actually sent.
fields.summary: Notification scheme sending mails to the mail queue for users without permission to see the Issue
Time Tracking: allow "include child issues" in addition to "include sub-tasks"
As an administrator, I would like to have the Plugin menu support submenus
Ability to view "Linked Issues" without the Browse project permission
Separate delete link permission from create link permission
SVN commit messages generated by Mylyn not well interpreted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32563].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 24th September 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

I have an update re: this feature request. I am happy to share that we will be addressing this as part of the new issue view experience currently being rolled out and improved. We have more to do to make this an incredible experience for you all (we still have some missing functionality that is expected), but this is one item we will be able to improve as part of our work in this area.

Our plan is for custom fields: multi-line text to always come as a rich text editor with the new WYSIWYG editor, which will include proper mentions functionality. Unfortunately, I can’t give a specific date on when this will be live, but it is on our roadmap in the near future. It will require you to be using the [new issue view experience which you can read more about with this link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html].

Thank you for your patience and continuing to provide feedback. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Regards,
 Taylor Pechacek
 tpechacek (at) atlassian (dot) com
 Senior Product Manager, Jira
{panel}
 

*Suggestion*

At the moment, mention only works in System field (Comment and Description). It would be great to make it works on custom text field as well.
fields.summary: Mentions should work with text custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-32548].
  {panel}

Lets say you have some *required* custom fields with *context* configured specifically for Project A, and you want to move an issue from Project B to Project A. When you move the issue, JIRA will prompt you to update those required fields through the UI. (This is step 3 of 4)

The order in which the custom fields appear does not match the order of the custom fields that you set up in the Issue Edit Screen. 

Example:
1. When I Edit an issue, I am presented with the Edit Issue screen like so: [^EditIssue.jpg]
2. When I attempt to move an issue into this project, of this issue type, the *step 3 of 4* of the Move process will prompt me to key in values for those required fields. The order of the custom fields differs: [^MoveIssue.jpg]

This can cause confusion for some customers who require those fields to be ordered exactly as they were in the Edit Issue screen.
fields.summary: Order fields on bulk move screen according to the order designated on the edit issue screen.

# You need to perform Bulk operation for over 300 or 400 issues.
# For example 'Move Operation'for these 300 or 400 issues.

*Actual Results*
This will display the 'Down for Maintenance page' but the operation is still running in the background which makes the user confuse if JIRA is down or is till performing the operation.
